thread.title: HIGH SCHOOLS: Brockton clinches postseason berth
thread.title_full: HIGH SCHOOLS: Brockton clinches postseason berth

author: The Enterprise
title: HIGH SCHOOLS: Brockton clinches postseason berth
text: Posted Oct. 5, 2015 at 10:31 PM Updated at 10:34 PM Posted Oct. 5, 2015 at 10:31 PM Updated at 10:34 PM It’s back to the postseason for the Brockton High girls volleyball team. The Boxers turned in a total team effort on Monday against Durfee, as they defeated the Hilltoppers, 3-0, to qualify for the postseason state tournament. Brockton (10-2, 3-0 Big Three) made quick work of Durfee, winning with scores of 25-10, 25-12 and 25-11. Courtney Francis had 25 assists and 100 percent serving to pace the Boxers, while teammate Jasmine Lafontant had eight kills and six aces. Elsewhere in high school sports: VOLLEYBALL Middleboro 3, Scituate 0: The Sachems (3-7, 3-5 Patriot League) cruised past the Sailors, 25-4, 25-8 and 25-15, with Lauren Empey having 10 kills and eight aces while Alyssa MacDermid going 9 for 9 on serves. King Philip 3, Stoughton 0: The Black Knights fell in straight games to the Warriors. FIELD HOCKEY Mansfield 2, Oliver Ames 1: Nicole Walker scored the equalizer for the Tigers (5-3-1) but it wasn’t enough. Midfielder Kendall Clifford played well for OA, as did goalkeeper Cassie Gavin, who made 11 saves. Stoughton 1, King Philip 1: Olivia Schlehuber had the only tally for the Black Knights, while Kara Ploss played well in net, making seven saves. Apponequet 2, Dighton-Rehoboth 1: Hannah Chapman scored two goals in the final two minutes of regulation to lift the Lakers (6-1-1, 6-1 South Coast Conference) to a win. Colette Macuch and Caitlin Baril each had an assist on Chapman’s goals. Erin Kelley scored the only goal for the Falcons. Middleboro 3, Whitman-Hanson 0: The Sachems jumped out to an early advantage and never surrendered the lead against the Panthers. GOLF Whitman-Hanson 251, Martha’s Vineyard 260: Senior captain Cole Manning led the Panthers (7-6, 6-6 Patriot League) at Ridder Farm Golf Club with an even-par 36. Sophomore Matt Stanish contributed with a 2-over 38, while junior Luke Tamulevich chipped in at 5-over. By The Enterprise
